title: BJP has finished Nitish Kumar physically and mentally: Pappu Yadav
content: Rajesh Ranjan alias Pappu Yadav, six-times Bihar MP is currently an Independent MP from Purnea in Seemanchal (border) area. Having a¬†bahubali (strongman) image, he also does lot of charity donating money to the needy people. Though it is an Assembly election in Bihar, he has been in the limelight for many reasons. Recently Mr. Yadav was seen sharing dais with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and was also caught on camera when he was not allowed to share the open vehicle in which Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav were moving in Patna. The Hindu caught him at his residence in Patna in which he spoke on several issues including giving advice to Tejashwi Yadav and Chirag Paswan to destroy the arrogance. He also asserted that he does not mind even though he was humiliated. Excerpts.

title: Engineer, Beauty Pageant Participant: All About Zubeen Garg's Cop Cousin
content: Zubeen Garg's cousin and Deputy Superintendent of Police Sandipan Garg, who has been arrested in connection with the singer's death in Singapore, has an engineering degree and had also participated in a beauty pageant.

title: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, Omar Yaghi Win Nobel Prize In Chemistry
content: Nobel Prize In Chemistry 2025: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, Omar Yaghi Win Nobel Prize In Chemistry

title: 'India United Only Under Aurangzeb': Pak's Khawaja Asif's Provocative Remark
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has made yet another baseless claim, saying India was "never truly united" except under the rule of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb -- a statement that easily crumbles under the weight of basic historical facts.

title: Senior Haryana IPS Officer Shoots Himself At His House In Chandigarh
content: Y Puran Kumar, a senior Haryana IPS officer, died by suicide at his Sector 11 Chandigarh residence by shooting himself, said officials.

title: Karnataka BJP Youth Wing Leader Hacked To Death, Cops Say Revenge Murder
content: A BJP youth wing leader was brutally hacked to death on a roadside in Karnataka's Gangavathi early this morning

title: Renowned Hairstylist Javed Habib Charged In Multi-Fraud Case, Lookout Notice Issued
content: Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal police have issued a lookout notice against renowned hairstylist Javed Habib and his family in connection with a multi-crore fraud case.

title: Women Possibly Twice At Risk Of Depression Than Men: Study
content: A study has found 6,000 gene variants responsible for causing depression among women, in addition to the 7,000 of those shared with men, potentially explaining why the risk is double in women.

title: 'Behaving like acting PM': Mamata's Mir Zafar jab at Shah; her advise for Modi
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused Union Home Minister Amit Shah of acting like a "Prime Minister" and cautioned PM Modi. She criticized the central government's flood relief efforts and alleged a lack of support. Banerjee also highlighted ongoing relief and rehabilitation work in flood-affected North Bengal, promising further oversight.

title: 'Glimpse of Viksit Bharat': PM hails Navi Mumbai airport; how it will help farmers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Navi Mumbai International Airport on Wednesday. Built by the Adani Group under a Public Private Partnership, this massive greenfield project, costing Rs 19,650 crore for its first phase, will ease congestion at Mumbai's existing airport.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Furore over doctor's arrest; FAIMA writes to Centre
content: Medical associations are demanding the immediate release of a doctor arrested in connection with child deaths linked to contaminated cough syrup. They urge a thorough investigation to ensure justice for victims and protect medical professionals from wrongful blame. The group also proposed measures to the health ministry to prevent future incidents, including central oversight and nationwide drug testing.

title: PM launches Mumbai Metro Aqua Line-3: Check stations, route, timings & travel time
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the final phase of Mumbai Metro Aqua Line-3 on October 9, 2025. This Rs 12,000 crore phase connects business hubs, entertainment zones, and the airport, integrating with existing transport networks. The entire 33.5 km underground line will serve 13 lakh passengers daily.

title: Amit Shah switches to Zoho: Ditches Gmail; signs off Trump-style
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has embraced Zoho Mail, a significant move towards promoting indigenous technology and reducing reliance on foreign platforms. This transition, alongside IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's adoption of Zoho's office suite, signals a broader government strategy for digital self-sufficiency.  Zoho's messaging app, Arattai, has also experienced a remarkable surge in users, highlighting the growing acceptance of Indian tech solutions.

title: Israel intercepts another Gaza aid flotilla: Soldier tries to destroy camera - watch
content: Israel intercepted a nine-boat aid flotilla carrying food and medical supplies, two days after deporting 171 activists. Troops boarded the vessels 120 nautical miles off Gaza's coast, with activists reporting an Israeli helicopter overhead. Israel stated the 145 activists were in good health and would be deported, calling the attempt to breach the blockade futile.

title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry: Trio win top honours for 'creating new rules'
content: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry honours Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M Yaghi. They developed metal-organic frameworks, a new molecular architecture. These porous materials offer custom-made solutions for energy, storage, and catalysis. This breakthrough revolutionises material design with vast potential for new functions.

title: US shutdown day 8: Pilots use ‚Äòchat line‚Äô for takeoffs, landings; ATC shortage worsens
content: A US government shutdown is causing significant air traffic control staffing shortages, forcing pilots to use advisory frequencies for coordination. Major airports are experiencing delays and temporary closures, with controllers working without pay and calling out sick. Passengers face mounting frustration due to extended wait times and disruptions.

title: Bihar polls: CM face confusion in MGB, seat chaos in NDA - decoding political drama
content: Bihar's upcoming assembly elections are marked by poetic negotiations and power plays within alliances. Jitan Ram Manjhi invokes poetry for fair seat-sharing in NDA, while Left allies in Mahagathbandhan reject 'insulting' proposals. The absence of a clear chief ministerial face and leadership confusion are key issues.

title: Bihar polls: Manjhi takes poetic dig at BJP; seat-sharing talks begin
content: Bihar's political landscape is heating up with seat-sharing talks and upcoming elections. Former Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi's cryptic post hints at dissatisfaction with NDA negotiations, while Tejashwi Yadav expresses confidence in the opposition's push for change.  With JD(U) and BJP leading, smaller parties and new fronts are maneuvering for influence.

title: Buying gadgets from US, Dubai?: HC returns Rolex after taking fine; what it means for you
content: The Delhi High Court ruled that a single Rolex watch is not commercial quantity, allowing a man to retrieve his seized item by paying a fine. This precedent clarifies that customs authorities must consider personal use, not just value, for imported goods. The decision offers guidance for travelers bringing electronics like iPhones and MacBooks from abroad.

title: Warriors vs Trail Blazers Preseason: Schedule, where to watch, injury update
content: The Portland Trail Blazers are set to face the Golden State Warriors in their first 2025-26 NBA preseason game. The Warriors, having already defeated the Lakers, aim to continue their preseason success. However, both teams are dealing with significant player absences, including Stephen Curry's brother Seth Curry for the Warriors and Damian Lillard for the Blazers.

title: Will UK ease visa norms fo Indians? What PM Starmer said
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer arrived in Mumbai with a large business delegation to bolster trade and investment following a landmark free trade pact. Starmer emphasized the economic opportunities and cultural ties, aiming to leverage India's growing economy for UK prosperity. The visit includes discussions on defense, AI, and cultural exchanges, underscoring a deepening partnership.

title: 'MS Dhoni's' mimicry: Rohit Sharma, wife can't stop laughing - watch
content: Rohit Sharma's infectious laughter at a recent awards ceremony, reacting to a spot-on MS Dhoni mimicry, stole the show. The viral moment contrasted with his serious reflections on India's post-2023 World Cup turnaround, crediting Rahul Dravid and team unity for recent ICC title wins. Rohit will continue playing for India in upcoming ODI series.

title: How rich is Dubai Princess Sheikha Mahra: All about her lavish lifestyle
content: Dubai Princess Sheikha Mahra, daughter of Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, has garnered significant attention for her opulent lifestyle and entrepreneurial ventures. Following her public divorce, she launched a luxury perfume brand, Mahra M1, with its inaugural fragrance "Divorce" symbolizing empowerment.

title: US-Pak missile deal: Cong calls it 'diplomatic setback'; takes shot at Centre
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has slammed the government after Pakistan was included in a US Department of War notification for Raytheon missile supplies. Ramesh highlighted the shift in diplomatic ties, noting Pakistan's addition to the list of recipients for advanced air-to-air missiles, a move he termed a diplomatic setback. The contract modification adds $41 million to the total value.

title: 'What if it had been Asad?' Owaisi hits out at BJP over shoe hurled at CJI Gavai
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi slammed the BJP and PM Modi after an advocate threw a shoe at CJI BR Gavai. Owaisi questioned the lack of a case against the accused, Rakesh Kishore, alleging religious bias and suggesting a different reaction if the perpetrator had a Muslim name. Kishore cited the CJI's remarks on Sanatan Dharma as his motive.

title: Chahal-Dhanashree: All the times they took a jab over cheating and alimony rumors
content: Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma have addressed rumors surrounding their strained relationship and divorce. Chahal denied cheating claims, stating he is a loyal person and has moved on. Verma also spoke about the emotional toll of the divorce and an incident involving a 'Sugar Daddy' t-shirt.

title: Karwa Chauth 2025: Simple and easy full-hand mehndi design ideas
content: Karwa Chauth 2025 calls for stunning mehndi. This guide offers unique, simple Indian designs, from moon motifs to couple silhouettes, perfect for celebrating love and tradition. Learn how to plan your full-hand mehndi, achieve a deep stain, and communicate with your artist for a truly personal and festive adornment.

title: Nobel Prize: How many Indians have won top honours? Here's the full list
content: Nobel Prize announcements for 2025 are underway. Prizes in Medicine, Physics, and Chemistry have been awarded. The world awaits Literature, Peace, and Economics awards. This article revisits notable Indian Nobel laureates. Their contributions span literature, physics, medicine, peace, economics, and chemistry. These achievements highlight India's significant impact on global knowledge and humanitarian efforts.

title: Lauren Kyle shares heartfelt message after Connor McDavid‚Äôs $25M deal
content: Connor McDavid's wife, Lauren Kyle, celebrated his new contract with the Edmonton Oilers. Her reaction mirrored fan relief and pride. The deal offers the team financial flexibility. Kyle's ventures, including Bar Trove, show her commitment to Edmonton. Their life and legacy are growing in the city, strengthening their bond with the community.

title: Fired, then called back: An IT professional‚Äôs dilemma; should he return?
content: After being fired by a foreign firm despite strong performance, a 31-year-old Indian IT consultant faces a dilemma when the same company invites him back. With promises of better conditions and higher pay, he must weigh financial benefits against past workplace toxicity. Here are five key factors professionals should assess before returning to a former employer.

title: 'First deposit Rs 60 crore': Bombay HC tells Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra for abroad travel
content: Bombay High Court has ordered Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra to deposit Rs 60 crore to travel abroad. This comes after their plea to quash a Look-Out Circular issued against them concerning an alleged Rs 60 crore fraud. The couple is accused of diverting investment funds for personal use.

title: Javed Habib booked: 20 cases against hair stylist
content: Uttar Pradesh police have filed over 20 cases against renowned hair stylist Javed Habib, his family, and associates for allegedly swindling victims out of ‚Çπ5-7 crore.  Operating as a gang under Follicle Global Company, they are accused of taking substantial cash investments from individuals.  Authorities are urging more victims to report their experiences.

title: ‚ÄòI wore red for you‚Äô: Canadian PM jokes with Donald Trump
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney met with US President Donald Trump at the White House, sharing lighthearted moments and discussing trade, defense, and global affairs. Carney praised Trump's leadership, while Trump described Carney as a "world-class leader." Despite trade tensions, both leaders acknowledged areas for collaboration, with Carney expressing optimism about future opportunities.

title: What is subway surfing? Two girls die performing dangerous viral stunt in New York
content: Two young girls, 12-year-old Zemfira Mukhtarov and 13-year-old Ebba Morina, died in a tragic subway surfing incident in Brooklyn. The girls were found on top of a J train after reportedly sneaking out to engage in the dangerous activity. Authorities are urging parents and educators to emphasize the extreme risks involved.

title: Beauty parlour to pay Rs 5L as woman loses earlobes to acidic ‚Äòherbal‚Äô mix
content: A Chennai makeup artist suffered severe earlobe damage after a 'herbal treatment' at a beauty parlour. The parlour owner has been ordered to pay ‚Çπ5 lakh compensation. The corrosive substance used in the treatment led to the loss of both earlobes, impacting the artist's career and personal life. Doctors confirmed the presence of trichloroacetic acid.

title: ‚ÄòI've done Parmatma's work‚Äô: Man who hurled shoe at CJI known for 'violent behaviour'
content: A suspended advocate, Rakesh Kishore, hurled a shoe at the Chief Justice of India, claiming divine instructions and expressing no remorse. The incident sparked protests, with demonstrators condemning the act as an affront to the Dalit community and demanding action against Kishore, who has past complaints of violent behavior.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Assam DSP Sandipan Garg, cousin of singer, arrested
content: Assam Police Service officer Sandipan Garg, cousin of the late singer Zubeen Garg, has been apprehended by the CID in connection with the singer's Singapore death. Garg, reportedly present during the incident, was detained after extensive questioning. He is expected in court today as the investigation intensifies, with authorities keeping further details confidential.

title: Pak convoy ambushed: 11 troops, 19 militants killed; TTP claims responsibility
content: Eleven Pakistani paramilitary personnel, including two officers, were killed in an ambush by Islamist militants near the Afghan border. The attack occurred while the troops were operating in a volatile region known for frequent militant assaults. Security forces have initiated a search operation for the perpetrators.

title: India comeback: 'Chances are very less' - Ex-cricketer doubts Shami's prospects
content: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra expressed skepticism regarding Mohammed Shami's return to the national team, citing his lack of recent match practice.  While acknowledging Shami's talent, Chopra noted he has fallen behind in the fast-bowling race. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar also emphasized the need for game time.  Strong domestic or IPL performances are crucial for Shami's comeback chances.

title: Air Force Day '25: Air Chief Marshal arrives in rare 1960s V8 car, all you need to know
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh made a striking entrance at Air Force Day celebrations in a vintage 1960s Ford Galaxie V8. This left-hand drive saloon, powered by a 6.4-litre V8 engine, served as the official staff car for Indian Air Force Chiefs from 1969 to 1992 and is now a museum piece.

title: 'In the name of Sanatan ... ': Kharge condemns attack on CJI Gavai
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge strongly condemned a shoe-throwing incident at the Supreme Court. He called the act an insult to Chief Justice of India BR Gavai. Kharge urged action against those attempting to create unrest. The incident occurred during a court hearing. The protest was linked to a recent court dismissal of a plea regarding a temple idol.

title: Fred Ramsdell was on ‚Äòoff-the-grid hiking trip‚Äô when Nobel Prize news broke
content: Immunologist Fred Ramsdell, 64, discovered he'd won the Nobel Prize in Medicine while on a digital detox in the remote US backcountry. His wife, Laura O‚ÄôNeill, regained cell service and found a flood of congratulatory messages. The couple had missed the Nobel Committee's call, with Ramsdell eventually contacting them nearly 20 hours later.

title: Pakistan: LeT, ISKP forge covert alliance in Balochistan; pact reportedly backed by ISI
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba and ISKP have reportedly formed a covert alliance in Balochistan. This partnership is allegedly engineered and funded by Pakistan's ISI. The groups aim to target Baloch people. There is a possibility of expansion to Jammu and Kashmir. Visual evidence shows commanders training together. This alliance follows India's counterterror actions.

title: 17 crore new jobs: Female workforce at a record high; why this labour surge is different
content: India has added 17 crore jobs between 2017‚Äì18 and 2023‚Äì24, with a notable surge in women‚Äôs workforce participation. Employment rose to 64.33 crore, while the unemployment rate dropped to 3.2%. Formal employment, wages, and self-employment also grew, driven by government schemes and sectoral shifts. Key initiatives are supporting skilling, women‚Äôs inclusion, and job creation across both rural and urban areas, marking a significant transformation in India‚Äôs labour market.

title: What does Aaron Judge‚Äôs wife Samantha Bracksieck do for a living?
content: Aaron Judge and his wife Samantha Bracksieck welcomed their first daughter, Nora Rose, in January. Bracksieck, who holds expertise in kinesiology and sports, has been a significant support throughout Judge's MLB career. The couple, who met in high school, maintains a low public profile and participates in charitable activities.

title: Ukraine captures Indian national fighting for Russian army: Report
content: Ukrainian forces have reportedly captured a 22-year-old Indian national fighting for the Russian army. Indian authorities are verifying the reports. The man, identified as Majoti Sahil Mohammed from Gujarat, allegedly joined the Russian military after a drug conviction. He claims he did not want to fight and surrendered. He was reportedly promised freedom and payment but received none.

title: India-UK trade deal: Starmer wants FTA implementation as soon as 'humanly possible'!
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer is pushing for the swift implementation of the India-UK Free Trade Agreement, calling it a significant post-Brexit achievement. He highlighted the immense opportunities for both nations, emphasizing that the deal is a 'launchpad' for future economic cooperation. Starmer's visit with a large delegation aims to maximize the benefits of this landmark agreement.

title: 40 Killed in Myanmar: Paragliders drop bombs on Buddhist festival celebrations
content: A paramotor attack on a festival and protest in central Myanmar killed at least 40 people and injured around 80. The military dropped bombs on a gathering in Chaung U township, with the National Unity Government attributing the attack to the junta. This incident highlights a disturbing trend of the junta using motorized paragliders against civilians.

title: 'Single khush hoon': Man performs 'shuddhi' milk bath ritual after divorce ‚Äì Watch
content: A Delhi man marked his divorce with a unique celebration, performing a traditional milk bath ritual followed by cutting a cake inscribed with "Happy Divorce 120 gram gold 18 lakh cash." He shared his joy online, declaring himself single, happy, and free.

title: Bill Nye calls proposed cuts an ‚Äòextinction-level event‚Äô for space exploration
content: Bill Nye, the 'Science Guy,' led a protest on Capitol Hill against proposed NASA budget cuts by the Trump administration.  These significant reductions threaten ongoing missions like the Perseverance rover and the Artemis program.  Nye argued that NASA's investment yields substantial economic and technological returns, supports thousands of jobs, and is vital for US global leadership in space.

title: How Shreyas Iyer won his place back in Indian team and 'stamped authority'
content: Shreyas Iyer shared his journey back to international cricket. After losing his central contract, he excelled in domestic tournaments and the Champions Trophy. Iyer focused on his game and proved critics wrong about his technique. He is now in strong form and preparing for the upcoming series against Australia.

title: Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda passes away after a road accident
content: Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda has passed away on October 8 following a road accident that occurred on September 27. He was admitted to Fortis Hospital, Mohali, and was on life support for spinal and head injuries sustained after his car collided with stray cattle. Jawanda was known for hit songs like 'Kangni' and films such as 'Jind Jaan'.

title: 'Who made decision to not act?' PM Modi grills 'weak' Cong over 26/11 response
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .
